metadata.Title: CVE-2015-7577 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
activerecord/lib/active_record/nested_attributes.rb in Active Record in Ruby on Rails 3.1.x and 3.2.x before 3.2.22.1, 4.0.x and 4.1.x before 4.1.14.1, 4.2.x before 4.2.5.1, and 5.x before 5.0.0.beta1.1 does not properly implement a certain destroy option, which allows remote attackers to bypass intended change restrictions by leveraging use of the nested attributes feature.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7577` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

rails - 2:4.2.6-1
ruby-actionmailer - 2:4.2.6-1
ruby-actionpack - 2:4.2.6-1
ruby-actionview - 2:4.2.6-1
ruby-activejob - 2:4.2.6-1
ruby-activemodel - 2:4.2.6-1
ruby-activerecord - 2:4.2.6-1
ruby-activesupport - 2:4.2.6-1
ruby-rails - 2:4.2.6-1
ruby-railties - 2:4.2.6-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: seth-arnold> In Oneiric-Saucy, rails package is just for transition; The rails package contains actual code from vivid onward

criterions.comment: rails package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.2.6-1').
